reviews.sentence: Corktown. The Corktown is very old and needs updating in every way. The bedspread is filled with cigarette holes. The carpet is old stained dark and ugly. However the sheets are clean it is bug free and quiet and so I got a great nights sleep. There is HBO wi fi a safe area UBER and LYFT to get to the Casinos which is only minutes away. No restaurants within safe walking that I saw. The service was great. I got hot water coffee microwave and there are soda and other machines available the first floor. Front Desk 24 hour was very attentive to my calls and needs. So for the cost I was satisfied.

Nice vibe coming along well. Stayed there for work recently. I always like to try and find smaller more interesting hotels when traveling and this renovation in progress did not disappoint. Note that the planned restaurant is not open yet and only 2 of 4 floors are renovated but the look is simple industrial style design. In addition to a row of restaurants bars and shops open on nearby Michigan Ave there is Mudgies and Atwater Brew pub open in the nearby neighborhood for local dining. Not in the heart of downtown but just outside of it.

Great Value Lovely Stay. My friend and I stayed here for one night while we were in town for a concert. We were pleasantly surprised on the newly remodeled and styled rooms. Free parking was also a huge plus. Room was very clean with all new decor fresh sheets and fluffy slippers and robes. We found a great deal through Express Deals on Priceline but I would expect the price of this hotel will go up as they continue to establish themselves and finish renovations. All rooms have been remodeled but they are still working on hallways elevators and eventually a restaurant. Uber to Ford Field was only a 5 minute drive and cost somewhere around 5.

Hipish and aforable. Good location in developing and hip neighborhood. Lots of great nearby shops bars and restaurants. Good aesthetics in mind and nice little touches here and there. Enjoyed our short and affordable stay. Awkwardness of hotel still being developed certain floors and elevators not yet remodeled. A few minor kinks here and there. phone did not work TV channels did not correspond to hotel provided channel list uncertainty as to wifi and coffee bar usage and eerily quiet reception area.

nice happy hour surrounding area could be daunting. great bed restaurants ten minutes by foot bars and breakfast would be a cold walk in winterealy nothing else in vicinity. not really a walking area a small restaurant is in the works.

Nice stay would recommend for price and location. reception was friendly and helpful with all our questions. we stayed for 2 nights there to see the Lions play. location was not bad walking distance. 10 1 5 minutes to Michigan Ave for several places to eat. Room although renovated did not have USB ports not many outlets no coffee maker no drawers for storage just a rack to hang a couple of items. One robe and one pair of slippers be nice to have 2 of each. Floor is concrete so need something on your feet. No restaurant but one should open next year. Can get coffee tea plus other drinks at small bar area and a small store. Not sure if we will stay again but it is still being renovated. Security parking area at back.

Cheap renovations not impressed. I live in Detroit and have friends and colleagues that stay here throughout the year a nice reasonable updated modern hotel would have been a nice addition. Maybe I will give them a second chance when the remodeling finishes but until then you are better off with an air bnb in this Corktown neighborhood. First and most likely last time I will ever stay here. would not recommend it to friends either. The price does not reflect the cheap remodeling that was done. Holes in bathroom doors fixtures are cheap and paint and wall repairs are cracking or very noticeable. They were going for hip cool and modern but I have stayed in boutique hotels in 3rd world countries that were more attractive and not as cold and boring in design. The beds and linens were comfortable. The fitness room was very sparse but is a nice addition. The business center they boast is a bar in the lobby with two computers and a printer not private at all. Rooms are small and walls are thin. we heard our neighbors talking all night. The cafe was not open at 8 am on a Saturday so expect to go elsewhere for food or coffee. Overall I am not impressed and will continue to utilize other hotels in the area.

The decor is very boutique style hip and modern with clean decor and a gift shop focusing on local artisans. It is not your standard property which is refreshing and memorable. When we stayed at this hotel it was under renovation and the city had a ban on drinking water at the time. Both of these things would generally a stay less than desirable but despite this the staff and management were extremely accommodating. The management left us a personally addressed note in our room and a bottle of fresh water and they served fresh donuts in the lobby to compensate for their lack of coffee due to the city wide water issue. You can tell this hotel is going to be very upscale and a designer property once the renovations are complete and the construction did not get in the way of our stay at all. No extra noise or obstacles.

Very Good. The style of the hotel modern and cozy. The little shop so you can buy some snacks and drinks. It would be nice to have breakfast at the hotel. Hope the restaurant their building will be finished soon.

Give this one a chance. Came here for the Detroit Auto Show and found a work in progress not necessarily a bad thing. The hotel is an old Holiday Inn under renovation a post industrial hipnes pervades and the staff is young and enthusiastic. True the air conditioners wheezed I could not control them nor turn them off the bathroom had no door the shower set up was peculiar half a sheet of thick glass no shower door requires a towel on the floor the sheets were a bit coarse my bed light stopped working and the bed footboards were so big they kept wacking me on the ankles. On the other hand the rooms were otherwise comfortable I liked the bathroom cart for health and beauty stuff the snack bar had interesting stuff for quick to go meals the pantry was well stocked my wife bought a fuzzy bathrobe iced flavored water and printing was free and the parking lot was secure. Corktown neighborhood is a bit grimy and light industrial but has some decent eateries and greasy spoons Batch Brewing Company a gastropub only a few blocks away is worth a visit just to play old board games. Cobo Hall is a brisk 15minute walk away. This one deserves a chance.

New Years dinner with friends. I only had the chance to eat dinner here in the restaurant Red Dun Kitchen with friends on NYE. What a great experience. The entire staff were very welcoming the food came out quickly and the food was amazing. Really enjoyed the windows looking into the kitchen from the dining room. They also have a good drink menu as well. Would definitely eat here again.

Great place. Very retro and unique. We absolutely loved it and will come again. The location was key and the staff was friendly. We ate breakfast there as well and we really enjoyed the food. The bar was pretty busy late night and there was a cool brewery across the street.

Love this modern boutique hotel. We stayed the night for an event in downtown Detroit a quick five minute Uber ride away and now I am looking for excuses to come to Detroit so we can stay at Trumbull and Porter. The styling furniture and atmosphere of the hotel is wonderful and modern. I found the bed comfortable and the exposed concrete floors and remodeled building reminded me of other boutique hotels in the area but this place is half the cost with all the atmosphere. The bathroom is not huge but I will gladly sacrifice that in favor of the afordability TP offers. We grabbed a quick drink and some appetizers before going to our event and my only regret was not having dinner too. The drinks were inventive and tasty and the food was outstanding.

What a gem. Clean rooms. Awesome decor. Only a 5 minute drive or Uber to downtown as well. I highly recommend staying here is you are looking for a boutique hotel with some personality. The staff was accommodating and friendly. there is just few breweries around the hotel but if you do not feel like going out to hotel restaurant is excellent.

Restaurant is very good food service really slow and unprofessional. Rooms are very strange if you do not mind any carpet. all concrete flooring no closets having to pay for coffee with no refills and water a very basic basic basic hotel. Staff were very friendly however and front desk very helpful.

Red Wings Concert and Football weekend. Great place great price food was OK for price. Would be back as close to great restaurants in Corktown. Let your customers know about parking charge not outrageous reasonable just did not know about.

Great price and hotel bar. We stayed here over NYE and it was the best deal we could find in downtown Detroit. This place is trendy and cool parking was easy and the staff were friendly fast and polite. The rooms were also trendy but also kind of reminded me of staying in youth hostels in Europe. We were totally great with this as we did nt plan on spending much time in the room but good for folks to know that may have stayed in all the other hotels in downtown Detroit as we have as this one has a different style. What I really appreciated about this hotel was that the hotel bar stayed open until 2 am it was a cool and chill bar people were hanging out there after their NYE festivities and it was a relief to be able to still grab a night cap before going up to bed. I travel to Detroit frequently as I am originally from there but now live out of state. I will definitely be staying here again.

Great hotel in a great area. Detroit is really happening and this is a great base to explore. The hotel is spotless and has a modern artsy decor. Staff was super accommodating and helpful. There are lots of bars and restaurants near by in Corktown. Other parts of town are easily accessible via a longer walk uber or cab.

Hip hotel. This hotel is one of a kind. My husband and I enjoyed the uniqueness in it. The room we had was 1 one queen bed. It was not huge but just fine for the night. We felt the walls were not well insulated as we could hear the guy in the next room on the phone which was odd. Other than that it was an enjoyable stay. We had a concert at Little Ceasars Arena. We decided to eat dinner at the hotels restaurant The Red Dun Kitchen before heading out. The food was amazing. do not pass up eating here. They accept reservations which we did not have but we were still able to get in. After dinner we took an Uber to Little Ceasars arena. I do not recommend eating at the Arena as the prices are crazy high. After the concert we hung out at the hotel bar. Drink prices are pretty high here but so worth it that you can just walk up to your room. The next morning we ate breakfast at the Red Dun Kitchen again since dinner was so amazing and breakfast did not disappoint. Thoroughly enjoyed my avocado toast and would order again. Amazing stay and hope to return again.

Fun Hip Hotel in Corktown. It started its life as a Holiday Inn back in the days when Wilie Horton and Al Kaline played just down the road in the big ballpark at Michigan and Trumbull. The rooms still have something of a utilitarian look but the new owners have added a number of hip modern touches including a fire pit outdoor seating a sumptuous gourmet restaurant and a stylish bar. The Corktown neighborhood the oldest in the city as proud locals will tell you features a number of historic homes dating to the late 19th and early 20th centuries as well has a burgeoning foodie scene. Travelers seeking reasonably priced accommodations in The Big D would do well to consider Trumbull and Porter.
it is a great value if you want to spend an evening to two in downtown Detroit. There is also a great little bar inside the hotel for a night cap.

We visited Detroit in October 2019 and I can not begin to explain how terrible the service was. We got there on a Friday and housekeeping never went into both rooms to clean at all. We asked for new towels and clean sheets 3 times and we never received anything they could not even leave them outside the door. It was extremely loud all three nights could not sleep at all. We let the manager know upon leaving and they offered us free breakfast. We spent 120 for three nights for two rooms and we got offered free breakfast. It was not worth sleeping in dirty sheets and using wet towels. Please save your money and try a different hotel. We unfortunately will not be back.
The food and drinks at the restaurant were great.
Very nice place good staff and nice location good art and a Kol coffee bar. But no contantle breakfast.
did not stay here. just ate at wonderful restaurant.
Amazing personnel. You hear everything that happens in the hallways but other than that it ’s amazing. Very accommodating great location. Easy walks to food and bars.

Amazing Bar Restaurant Service. My fiancé and I had a wonderful stay. Their staff is great and we were immensely impressed with the bar and their employees. The mimosas and fish bowls are delish. Give a shoutout to Kyra and tell her to whip up a fish bowl for you. we highly recommended this hotel and we will absolutely come again for our next summer visit to Detroit.

strange and unreliable staff. Imeditely upon entering I knew this was going to be a unique experience. The industrial style decor is as cold as the concrete floors. My television did not work and the 7 am breakfast did not happen until 8 am due to an employee not showing up for work. The desk staff and bar manager were polite and professional but that was all that was good about the property.

Cool quirky place. Good value for a last minute stay cation. Rooms were on the small side but sparkling clean. We enjoyed a drink at Red Dun but did not have dinner although the menu looked awesome as we had plans at a restaurant nearby. Excellent Corktown location. Would like to return in the summer when the outside space is open.
Great hotel within walking distance of bars and restaurants in the Corktown neighborhood of Detroit.
